clinical_study.brief_title: Post‐Traumatic Stress Symptoms (PTSS) in Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence and Correlates of Post-Traumatic Stress Symptoms (PTSS) in Adolescent Solid Organ Transplant Recipients (CTOTC-11)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

collaborator.agency: Clinical Trials in Organ Transplantation in Children

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is conducted to better understand Post-Traumatic Stress Symptoms (PTSS) in adolescent transplant recipients and their parent/guardian and to see if PTSS play a role in the way adolescent transplant recipients take their prescribed medicine.
Target population: medically stable adolescent solid organ (e.g., heart, kidney, liver, lung, small bowel) transplant recipients and their parent(s)/guardian.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months retrospective data to 6 months post enrollment
primary_outcome.description: Defined by fluctuation in medication blood levels. Calculated as the standard deviation (variation) of a minimum of 3 outpatient tacrolimus trough levels, obtained for one year, consisting of 6 months prior to study enrollment plus 6 months post study enrollment.

primary_outcome.measure: University of California at Los Angeles Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Reaction Index DSM-5 (UCLA PTSD RI DSM-5) Total Score
primary_outcome.description: The UCLA PTSD RI DSM-5 is a widely used and validated self-report questionnaire assessing posttraumatic stress symptoms (PTSS) in children and adolescents ages 8-18 years.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined by an MLVI greater than 2.

Defined as the existence of threshold scores in a symptoms constellation corresponding to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition (DSM-5) definition of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). Method: University of California at Los Angeles Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Reaction Index DSM-5 version (UCLA PTSD RI DSM-5) self-report questionnaire.
Measured by the UCLA Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Reaction Index (PTSD-RI) self-report subscale summary score.
Measured using the Impact of Event Scale (IES) self-report questionnaire.
Measured using IES self-report questionnaire subscore.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months retrospective data to 6 months post enrollment
6 months retrospective data to 6 months post enrollment

secondary_outcome.description: Depression/distress measured using the Children's Depression Inventory - Short Form (CDI-S) self-report questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) Assessment Using the PedsQL Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the child self-report Pediatric Quality of Life (PedsQL) version 4.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: QOL Assessment Using PedsQL Subscale Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the child self-report PedsQL version 4.0 subscale scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: QOL Assessment Using the HRQOL (PedsQL) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the child self-report Transplant-Specific Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQOL) scale (PedsQL) version 4.0 summary score.
Measured using the parent/guardian self-report PedsQL Family Impact version 2.0 summary score.
Measured using the parent/guardian self-report PedsQL Family Impact version 2.0 subscale scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Types of traumas identified as salient by the child
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the University of California at Los Angeles Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Reaction Index DSM-5 version (UCLA PTSD RI DSM-5).

secondary_outcome.measure: Types of traumas identified as salient by the parent
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the parent/guardian Impact of Event Scale (IES).

other_outcome.description: Potential impact of steroid use on PTSD will be assessed by a correlation coefficient between mean steroid dose per kilogram.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Outcome: Presence of Donor Specific Antibodies (DSA)

arm_group.description: Questionnaire battery at enrollment (Participants and their parents/guardians) Clinical data from patient's chart (6 months of retrospective data & 6 months of prospective tacrolimus trough level data)

intervention.intervention_name: Assessment of adherence, mental health, behavioral, quality of life and biological constructs

study_pop.textblock: Adolescent transplant recipients at risk for non-adherence and can reliably answer self-report questionnaires.
